oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure GRUB 2 is configured to run Linux operating system with argument page_poison=1
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for argument page_poison=1 in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if page_poison=1 is present in the GRUB2 environment variable block in /boot/grub2/grubenv

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure GRUB 2 is configured to run Linux operating system with argument pti=on
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for argument pti=on in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if pti=on is present in the GRUB2 environment variable block in /boot/grub2/grubenv

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure GRUB 2 is configured to run Linux operating system with argument slub_debug=P
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for argument slub_debug=P in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if slub_debug=P is present in the GRUB2 environment variable block in /boot/grub2/grubenv

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure GRUB 2 is configured to run Linux operating system with argument vsyscall=none
oval:metadata.oval:description: Look for argument vsyscall=none in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

oval:criterion.comment: Check if vsyscall=none is present in the GRUB2 environment variable block in /boot/grub2/grubenv

oval:metadata.oval:title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
oval:metadata.oval:description: If stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

ns4:textfilecontent54_state.ns4:subexpression:
if \[ "\$PS1" \]; then
\s+parent=\$\(ps -o ppid= -p \$\$\)
\s+name=\$\(ps -o comm= -p \$parent\)
\s+case "\$name" in sshd\|login\) exec tmux ;; esac
fi
